result.execSummary:
All charges against Marcus Shata Adams in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Marcus Shata Adams is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court
Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcus Shata Adams

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.  sb
Assessment for Attorney Fees in the amount of $1946.00 entered as ordered by the court on 11/08/2016  to pay $50.00 monthly.  Final payment due by 09/03/2019. Failure to pay is a Civil Judgment.
Affidavit and order for payment of attorney fees and costs signed and filed.  Ramon Valdez  $1946.00
Signed and Filed: Affidavit and Order for Payment of Attorney Fee's and Costs

Defendant Marcus Shata Adams in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  May Y. Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Case continued on defense motion for exclusion.  As stated on the record Court granted the defense motion for exclusion.
Based on Court granting the motion for exclusion State's motion to dismiss the case heard and granted.

Defendant Marcus Shata Adams in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  May Y. Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  State has not filed jury documents at this time and requested time to file the jury documents.  Defense motion for exclusion of State's jury documents heard.  Defense motion for dismissal of the case heard.  Case passed.

Attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez in court.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Case in court for a scheduled final pretrial conference.  State does not have its file.  Defense counsel has attempted to contact the defendant by telephone and was unsuccessful.  Defense has no explanation for defendant's non-appearance.  Court ordered and stayed a bench warrant to the next court date in Branch 31 for jury trial on 10/24/2016 at 8:30 am.

Defendant Marcus Shata Adams in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  May Y. Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial conference and jury trial in Branch 31.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 10, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 24, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marcus Shata Adams in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Law intern Renee Arndt under the supervision ofTaylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for motion hearing.  Case recalled at 3:54 pm.  Arguments heard.  For reasons stated on the record, Court DENIED the defense motion.  Defense requests status conference date.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 4.  All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2016 this case will be assigned to Judge Hannah Dugan - Branch 31 in Room 622 - Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for September 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Filed:
*  State's Reply to Defense Motion to Dismiss and Find Carrying Concealed Weapon Bar Unconstitutional.
to Dismiss the Criminal Complaint, received and filed

Defendant Marcus Shata Adams in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense requested a motion date.  Court ordered defense to file any motions by June 16, 2016; State's response to be filed by July 14, 2016.  Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 4.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 28, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Marcus Shata Adams in court.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The defendant is not eligible for Public Defender representation but advised the Court that he can't afford to retain private counsel.  Court will appoint counsel at the county's expense.  Court appoints attorney Ramon Valdez, who is present in court and accepts the appointment; order signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.  Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 04.

Defendant Marcus Shata Adams in court.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 28, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Marcus Shata Adams not in court.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, recompense is not an issue.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 7/13/15 @ 1:30 pm
